page.title: 14Religion in Poringland
page.content: Religion around Poringland consists of 4 churches.All Saints Church, Framingham Earl Church, Free (Evangelical) Church, and a Methodist Church. The first 2 date back to 1070 when they were built on bones.The local Reverend looks after both of these and conducts various activities within the church,womens groups, Brownies etc.The congregation for the church of England Services consists of about 50 people but in the Free Churches it is only about 10 or 15.No children attend the Free Churches. Only the Framingham Earl Church has a serviceable burial ground in use. It is commonly believed by the locals that a devil haunts the crossroads and a very strong vicar is needed to keep away evil.
